sections.title: FastAPI
content: FastAPI framework, high performance, easy to learn, fast to code, ready for production
Documentation: https://fastapi.tiangolo.com
Source Code: https://github.com/fastapi/fastapi
FastAPI is a modern, fast (high-performance), web framework for building APIs with Python based on standard Python type hints.
The key features are:

List:
: Very high performance, on par with  and  (thanks to Starlette and Pydantic). One of the fastest Python frameworks available.
Fast to code: Increase the speed to develop features by about 200% to 300%. *
Fewer bugs: Reduce about 40% of human (developer) induced errors. *
: Great editor support. Completion everywhere. Less time debugging.
: Designed to be easy to use and learn. Less time reading docs.
: Minimize code duplication. Multiple features from each parameter declaration. Fewer bugs.
: Get production-ready code. With automatic interactive documentation.
Standards-based: Based on (and fully compatible with) the open standards for APIs:  (previously known as Swagger) and JSON Schema.
* estimation based on tests on an internal development team, building production applications.
sections.content_text:
FastAPI framework, high performance, easy to learn, fast to code, ready for production

Documentation: https://fastapi.tiangolo.com

Source Code: https://github.com/fastapi/fastapi

FastAPI is a modern, fast (high-performance), web framework for building APIs with Python based on standard Python type hints.

The key features are:

List:
: Very high performance, on par with  and  (thanks to Starlette and Pydantic). One of the fastest Python frameworks available.
Fast to code: Increase the speed to develop features by about 200% to 300%. *
Fewer bugs: Reduce about 40% of human (developer) induced errors. *
: Great editor support. Completion everywhere. Less time debugging.
: Designed to be easy to use and learn. Less time reading docs.
: Minimize code duplication. Multiple features from each parameter declaration. Fewer bugs.
: Get production-ready code. With automatic interactive documentation.
Standards-based: Based on (and fully compatible with) the open standards for APIs:  (previously known as Swagger) and JSON Schema.

* estimation based on tests on an internal development team, building production applications.

sections.title: Installation
content: Create and activate a virtual environment and then install FastAPI:

Code example:
pipinstall"fastapi[standard]"
: Make sure you put "fastapi[standard]" in quotes to ensure it works in all terminals.

sections.title: Check it
content: Open your browser at http://127.0.0.1:8000/items/5?q=somequery.
You will see the JSON response as:
You already created an API that:

List:
Receives HTTP requests in the   and /items/{item_id}.
Both  take  operations (also known as HTTP ).
The  /items/{item_id} has a path parameter  that should be an .
The  /items/{item_id} has an optional  query parameter .

sections.title: Example upgrade
content: Now modify the file  to receive a body from a  request.
Declare the body using standard Python types, thanks to Pydantic.

Code example:
update_item   
     "item_name"
The fastapi dev server should reload automatically.

sections.title: Performance
content: Independent TechEmpower benchmarks show  applications running under Uvicorn as one of the fastest Python frameworks available, only below Starlette and Uvicorn themselves (used internally by FastAPI). (*)
To understand more about it, see the section Benchmarks.
sections.content_text:
Independent TechEmpower benchmarks show  applications running under Uvicorn as one of the fastest Python frameworks available, only below Starlette and Uvicorn themselves (used internally by FastAPI). (*)

To understand more about it, see the section Benchmarks.

sections.title: Dependencies
content: FastAPI depends on Pydantic and Starlette.
sections.content_text: FastAPI depends on Pydantic and Starlette.

sections.title: Dependencies
content: When you install FastAPI with pip install "fastapi[standard]" it comes with the  group of optional dependencies:

List:
email-validator - for email validation.

List:
- Required if you want to use the TestClient.
 - Required if you want to use the default template configuration.
python-multipart - Required if you want to support form , with request.form().

List:
- for the server that loads and serves your application. This includes uvicorn[standard], which includes some dependencies (e.g. ) needed for high performance serving.
fastapi-cli[standard] - to provide the  command.
This includes fastapi-cloud-cli, which allows you to deploy your FastAPI application to FastAPI Cloud.

List:
This includes fastapi-cloud-cli, which allows you to deploy your FastAPI application to FastAPI Cloud.

This includes fastapi-cloud-cli, which allows you to deploy your FastAPI application to FastAPI Cloud.

List:
This includes fastapi-cloud-cli, which allows you to deploy your FastAPI application to FastAPI Cloud.

sections.title: Without  Dependencies
content: If you don't want to include the  optional dependencies, you can install with pip install fastapi instead of pip install "fastapi[standard]".
sections.content_text: If you don't want to include the  optional dependencies, you can install with pip install fastapi instead of pip install "fastapi[standard]".

sections.title: Without fastapi-cloud-cli
content: If you want to install FastAPI with the standard dependencies but without the fastapi-cloud-cli, you can install with pip install "fastapi[standard-no-fastapi-cloud-cli]".
sections.content_text: If you want to install FastAPI with the standard dependencies but without the fastapi-cloud-cli, you can install with pip install "fastapi[standard-no-fastapi-cloud-cli]".

sections.title: Additional Optional Dependencies
content: There are some additional dependencies you might want to install.
Additional optional Pydantic dependencies:

List:
pydantic-settings - for settings management.
pydantic-extra-types - for extra types to be used with Pydantic.
Additional optional FastAPI dependencies:

List:
- Required if you want to use ORJSONResponse.
 - Required if you want to use UJSONResponse.

sections.title: FastAPI
content: FastAPI-Framework, hohe Performanz, leicht zu lernen, schnell zu entwickeln, produktionsreif
Dokumentation: https://fastapi.tiangolo.com/de
: https://github.com/fastapi/fastapi
FastAPI ist ein modernes, schnelles (hoch performantes) Webframework zur Erstellung von APIs mit Python auf Basis von Standard-Python-Typhinweisen.
Seine SchlÃ¼ssel-Merkmale sind:

List:
: Sehr hohe Performanz, auf AugenhÃ¶he mit  und  (dank Starlette und Pydantic). Eines der schnellsten verfÃ¼gbaren Python-Frameworks.
Schnell zu entwickeln: ErhÃ¶hen Sie die Geschwindigkeit bei der Entwicklung von Features um etwa 200 % bis 300 %. *
Weniger Bugs: Verringern Sie die von Menschen (Entwicklern) verursachten Fehler um etwa 40 %. *
: Hervorragende Editor-UnterstÃ¼tzung. Code-VervollstÃ¤ndigung Ã¼berall. Weniger Zeit mit Debuggen verbringen.
: So konzipiert, dass es einfach zu benutzen und zu erlernen ist. Weniger Zeit mit dem Lesen von Dokumentation verbringen.
: Minimieren Sie die Verdoppelung von Code. Mehrere Features aus jeder Parameterdeklaration. Weniger Bugs.
: Erhalten Sie produktionsreifen Code. Mit automatischer, interaktiver Dokumentation.
Standards-basiert: Basierend auf (und vollstÃ¤ndig kompatibel mit) den offenen Standards fÃ¼r APIs:  (frÃ¼her bekannt als Swagger) und JSON Schema.
* SchÃ¤tzung basierend auf Tests in einem internen Entwicklungsteam, das Produktionsanwendungen erstellt.

sections.title: Rendimiento
content: Benchmarks independientes de TechEmpower muestran aplicaciones  ejecutÃ¡ndose bajo Uvicorn como uno de los frameworks Python mÃ¡s rÃ¡pidos disponibles, solo por debajo de Starlette y Uvicorn (usados internamente por FastAPI). (*)

sections.title: Dependencias
content: FastAPI depende de Pydantic y Starlette.
sections.content_text: FastAPI depende de Pydantic y Starlette.

sections.title: Dependencias
content: Cuando instalas FastAPI con pip install "fastapi[standard]" viene con el grupo  de dependencias opcionales:

List:
email-validator - para validaciÃ³n de correos electrÃ³nicos.
Usadas por Starlette:

List:
- Requerido si deseas usar el TestClient.
 - Requerido si deseas usar la configuraciÃ³n de plantilla predeterminada.
python-multipart - Requerido si deseas soportar  de forms, con request.form().
Usadas por FastAPI / Starlette:

List:
- para el servidor que carga y sirve tu aplicaciÃ³n. Esto incluye uvicorn[standard], que incluye algunas dependencias (por ejemplo, ) necesarias para servir con alto rendimiento.
fastapi-cli - para proporcionar el comando .

sections.title: Sin Dependencias
content: Si no deseas incluir las dependencias opcionales , puedes instalar con pip install fastapi en lugar de pip install "fastapi[standard]".

semantic_chunks.text:
# FastAPI

FastAPI framework, high performance, easy to learn, fast to code, ready for production

Documentation: https://fastapi.tiangolo.com

Source Code: https://github.com/fastapi/fastapi

FastAPI is a modern, fast (high-performance), web framework for building APIs with Python based on standard Python type hints.

The key features are:

List:
: Very high performance, on par with  and  (thanks to Starlette and Pydantic). One of the fastest Python frameworks available.
Fast to code: Increase the speed to develop features by about 200% to 300%. *
Fewer bugs: Reduce about 40% of human (developer) induced errors. *
: Great editor support. Completion everywhere. Less time debugging.
: Designed to be easy to use and learn. Less time reading docs.
: Minimize code duplication. Multiple features from each parameter declaration. Fewer bugs.
: Get production-ready code. With automatic interactive documentation.
Standards-based: Based on (and fully compatible with) the open standards for APIs:  (previously known as Swagger) and JSON Schema.

* estimation based on tests on an internal development team, building production applications.
semantic_chunks.title: FastAPI

# FastAPI - Performance

Independent TechEmpower benchmarks show  applications running under Uvicorn as one of the fastest Python frameworks available, only below Starlette and Uvicorn themselves (used internally by FastAPI). (*)

semantic_chunks.text:
# FastAPI - Dependencies

When you install FastAPI with pip install "fastapi[standard]" it comes with the  group of optional dependencies:

List:
email-validator - for email validation.

List:
- Required if you want to use the TestClient.
 - Required if you want to use the default template configuration.
python-multipart - Required if you want to support form , with request.form().

List:
- for the server that loads and serves your application. This includes uvicorn[standard], which includes some dependencies (e.g. ) needed for high performance serving.
fastapi-cli[standard] - to provide the  command.
This includes fastapi-cloud-cli, which allows you to deploy your FastAPI application to FastAPI Cloud.

List:
This includes fastapi-cloud-cli, which allows you to deploy your FastAPI application to FastAPI Cloud.
semantic_chunks.title: FastAPI - Dependencies

semantic_chunks.text:
# FastAPI - Without  Dependencies

If you don't want to include the  optional dependencies, you can install with pip install fastapi instead of pip install "fastapi[standard]".
semantic_chunks.title: FastAPI - Without  Dependencies

semantic_chunks.text:
# FastAPI - Without fastapi-cloud-cli

If you want to install FastAPI with the standard dependencies but without the fastapi-cloud-cli, you can install with pip install "fastapi[standard-no-fastapi-cloud-cli]".
semantic_chunks.title: FastAPI - Without fastapi-cloud-cli

semantic_chunks.text:
# FastAPI - Additional Optional Dependencies

There are some additional dependencies you might want to install.

Additional optional Pydantic dependencies:

List:
pydantic-settings - for settings management.
pydantic-extra-types - for extra types to be used with Pydantic.

Additional optional FastAPI dependencies:

List:
- Required if you want to use ORJSONResponse.
 - Required if you want to use UJSONResponse.
